channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Three people dead after vehicle plunges into farm pond
item.description: Three people have died after getting trapped in a submerged vehicle in a farm pond near Raetihi today.

item.title: Sixteen days without a new case of Covid-19, but still one active case
item.description: There remains one active case of Covid-19 in New Zealand, with the Health Ministry today confirming no new cases for the 16th day in a row.

item.title: Body found in Hunua believed to be missing woman
item.description: A body found in Hunua yesterday is believed to be that of missing woman Elicia Hughes-Sutherland.

item.title: Alligator weed creeps into Manawatū
item.description: The public are being urged to report sightings of one of the world's most invasive pest plants - alligator weed - in the Mangaone Stream and lower Manawatū catchment.

item.title: Feral deer sightings spark concern for kauri forests
item.description: Northland residents are being urged to report feral deer sightings after several animals were spotted in the area.

item.title: Great Walks bookings re-open this week
item.description: Bookings will start opening for domestic travellers on seven of the Great Walks on Tuesday, but the popular Routeburn and Milford tracks remain closed for at least another month.

item.title: Snowfall and ice warnings for South Island after chilly night
item.description: Snowfall and ice warnings are in place across the lower South Island after another night of temperatures in the negatives.

item.title: Woman charged over Harbour Bridge dance video
item.description: A woman has been charged after appearing to dance on Auckland's Harbour Bridge.

item.title: Victory declared over mosquito species
item.description: An exotic mosquito species that could have posed a serious health risk to New Zealanders has been eradicated.

item.title: Homicide investigation launched after Northland stabbing
item.description: A homicide inquiry has been launched after a man was fatally stabbed in Moerewa overnight.

item.title: Two people dead in separate crashes overnight
item.description: One person was killed following a crash on Banks Peninsula while another person died following a two-car crash near Whakatane.

item.title: Arthur Taylor recalled to Rimutaka Prison, source says
item.description: Prominent jailhouse lawyer Arthur Taylor is back in prison.

item.title: Eruption survivors threaten to sue White Island Tours
item.description: A lawyer representing Australian victims of the Whakaari/White Island disaster says they are exploring legal action against White Island Tours.

item.title: 'There's a lot of hope and promise to cure food allergies'
item.description: Many food allergies could be cured, possibly permanently, by retraining the immune system, says allergy expert Dr Kari Nadeau.

item.title: Jetstar should offer refunds for cancelled flights - Consumer NZ
item.description: Consumer New Zealand believes Jetstar should not have taken some bookings for flights it is now cancelling.

item.title: Surprise donation a boost for South Island eco-sanctuary
item.description: The operator of an eco-sanctuary in Golden Bay said a large surprise donation would allow it to advance critical conservation plans.

item.title: Covid-19: No new cases for 15th day in a row
item.description: There are no new cases of covid-19 in New Zealand for the 15th consecutive day, with just one active case remaining.

item.title: 'Welcome home': greeting eases tension after long stay in India
item.description: A New Zealander who arrived home on a repatriation flight from Delhi says he was overwhelmed by the warm welcome at the airport.
